GitPushTask

Extends \GitBaseTask

Wrapper aroung git-push

Use \Project#createTask to register a new Task.

author

Victor Farazdagi simple.square@gmail.com
version

$Id: 8406c9cfd560b995db09e9888334355641cd3975 $
package

phing.tasks.ext.git
see
since 2.4.3
link

http://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-push.html

Logs a message with the given priority.

log(string $msg, integer $level = \Project::MSG_INFO) : void
inherited

Arguments

$msg

string

The message to be logged.

$level

integer

The message's priority at this message should have

Called by the project to let the task do it's work. This method may be called more than once, if the task is invoked more than once. For example, if target1 and target2 both depend on target3, then running <em>phing target1 target2</em> will run all tasks in target3 twice.

main()
inherited abstract

Should throw a BuildException if someting goes wrong with the build

This is abstract here. Must be overloaded by real tasks.

Configure this task if it hasn't been done already.

maybeConfigure()
inherited

Properties

Instead of naming each ref to push, specifies that all refs --all key to git-push

allRemotes : boolean
var

Type(s)

boolean

Mirror to remote repository --mirror key to git-push

mirror : boolean
var

Type(s)

boolean

Same as prefixing repos with colon --delete argument to git-push

delete : string
var

Type(s)

string

Push all refs under refs/tags --tags key to git-fetch

tags : boolean
var

Type(s)

boolean

<repository> argument to git-push

--force, -f key to git-push

force : boolean
